content: colleges prioritized making people feel perfectly safe over everything else and produced a generation afraid to fail, and thus afraid to take risk, and thus on pace to accomplish extremely little

content.html: dude that went to a $31,000/year high school is pretty sure other people are not comfortable enough with the risks of failing in life. ok. thanks bro. üëç failure for you is being a partner at a transactional law firm. failure for others is not providing for their kids. wake up.
